meanings.definition: adsukis (verb): to move quickly and suddenly
meanings.sent1: The cat adsukis across the room to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She adsukis through the crowd to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel adsukis up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: The wind adsukis through the leaves, creating a rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The ball adsukis down the hill, gaining speed with each roll.

meanings.sent1: The sudden adsukis of the car startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: His adsukis towards the finish line secured his victory.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected adsukis of the dancer added flair to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The adsukis of the falling star captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The adsukis of the cheetah was a blur of speed and agility.
